metadata.title: CVE-2019-15132 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Zabbix through 4.4.0alpha1 allows User Enumeration. With login requests, itis possible to enumerate application usernames based on the variability ofserver responses (e.g., the "Login name or password is incorrect" and "Nopermissions for system access" messages, or just blocking for a number ofseconds). This affects both api_jsonrpc.php and index.php.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15132` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
zabbix-frontend-php - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
zabbix-java-gateway - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
zabbix-server-mysql - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
zabbix-server-pgsql - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: zabbix package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.0.12+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm3').
